definition: to chatter or jabber on and on
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: That won't stop us from blathering on about it, of course.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这并不能阻止我们在这个问题上喋喋不休。

sentences.english: I didn't understand the chatter, almost as much as they.
sentences.chinese: 我不明白这喋喋不休的扯谈，他们也差不多如此。

sentences.english: Her endless talking is really bothering me.
sentences.chinese: 她讲话喋喋不休真令我烦。

sentences.english: His wife kept on at him to buy her a new coat.
sentences.chinese: 他老婆喋喋不休地唠叨要他为她买一件新袄子。

sentences.english: The teacher harangued us all about our untidy work.
sentences.chinese: 老师对于凌乱的作业对我们全部喋喋不休地训斥。

sentences.english: When I left he was still drivelling on about his popularity in school.
sentences.chinese: 当我离开时他还在喋喋不休地胡说他在学校的声望。

sentences.english: Don't worry, we won't belabor this topic.
sentences.chinese: 别担心，我们不会就这个问题喋喋不休的。

sentences.english: I was victimized the whole evening by his constant chatter.
sentences.chinese: 整个晚上我都为他的喋喋不休所扰。

sentences.english: He was hotted up by her constant chatter.
sentences.chinese: 她的喋喋不休令他烦躁不安。

sentences.english: In its default configuration, NAB is a real chatterbox.
sentences.chinese: 在默认设定下，NAB真是喋喋不休。

sentences.english: She clattered on and on about her children.
sentences.chinese: 她喋喋不休地谈论她的儿女。

sentences.english: The young workers cackled their discontent with poor pay.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的工人们对低工资喋喋不休地表示不满。
他们只是坐着喋喋不休。

sentences.english: That stupid television speaker is drivelling on again !
sentences.chinese: 那个愚蠢的电视又在喋喋不休地胡说了。

sentences.english: I know that his tongue wags.
sentences.chinese: 我知道他一说话就喋喋不休。

sentences.english: Seventhly, do not allow a prating swallow to possess your eaves.
sentences.chinese: 第七，不要让喋喋不休的燕子占据了你的屋檐。

definition: long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
unceasing torrent (idiom)/talking non-stop/gabbling forty to the dozen
not to overlook, nor spare (idiom); unwilling to forgive/to treat severely without listening to excuses
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to complain/to grumble/to harbor a complaint/to feel dissatisfied
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining
